title: So, with the release of Ornn can we get some specific new "Tenacity" items for us melee folk?
body:
Dota's Black King bar pops to mind.
We just need some ways for windowed CC redruction to outplay the growing number of disables.

Garen's W was a step in the right direction but with the increasing number of Crowd Control some immobile melee champions are going to be flamed for AFK.

I'd be interested in a melee-only, resist-based item with an item that would grant temporary unstoppability, i.e. immunity to crowd control, or a similar effect that would allow tanks and fighters to resist CC at key moments without it working on ranged champions or assassins. I find it very strange that mages and marksmen both receive powerful counters to crowd control (Banshee's Veil and Mercurial Scimitar), and even supports get to access Mikael's Crucible as an extra cleanse for the marksman, yet tanky classes, who are the most exposed to CC and often in greatest need of resisting it, have no such dedicated effect.

To a larger degree, I think CC in League might need a pass in how it's applied, as I feel there's too much crowd control in the game, and too much of it has very little counterplay against enemies in melee range. Morgana's Q, for example, is really interactive against a ranged opponent, who can see it coming and move out of the way, but offers nothing of the sort to melee enemies, who get caught instantly in a 3-second root. Tanks and juggernauts get a bad rap for having kits that punish enemies simply for being near them, yet that is the same problem that affects a whole bunch of abilities, especially skillshots.

A lot of the game's counterplay feels like it presumes that interactions happens between two ranged opponents at some distance from each other, and doesn't at all account for how melee champions end up dealing with those effects. Giving melee champions better tools to deal with abilities and CC could help mitigate the issue, but the only way to solve it is going to be by making sure each champion remains interactive even when in melee range of their opponent.
Not to invalidate or counter your point- imagine that item on Yi or even a rare Kayle.

For sure, that is _exactly_ the kind of abuse case I'd want to avoid. This I think is also one of the core problems with itemization: we've reached a point where it's clear that some items are meant to be used only by certain classes, yet the framework is such that anyone can equip practically any item if they have the gold for it, and thereby abuse its effects. Even if the item only offered pure resists alongside its active, that could still be enough to put it at risk of getting bought by squishies with heals and shields, e.g. Ekko, Kayle, Yi, and so on.

One potential gate to this, albeit a super-clunky one, could be to only have the active unlock once above a certain max health threshold, but in the end it just goes to show that itemization in League operates very differently from its current intended function, offering "choices" that are no longer seen as innovative or exciting, but rather abusive and restrictive to design overall.

Except assassins are invalidated even harder by cc since they are melee AND squishy, unlike bruisers or juggernauts, they need even more help.

But assassins are *supposed* to be countered by CC.  If you're going in on a squishy target by themselves, good.  If you're going in on a squishy target with Alistar standing next to them, not good.  You don't deserve to get a kill in that situation, maybe not even to survive.  Make better decisions next time.

Not to mention that in order for Ornn to be at all relevant to the discussion it would have to be Ornn *and* Alistar standing next to the guy you're trying to assassinate.  And you want Riot to let you succeed at that 1v3?  Do you have any idea how broken that would be?

Bruisers often struggle to find their role in a teamfight to balance the fact that being great soloers makes them splitpush monsters (Jax, for example).  Trying to dive front to back SHOULD be risky; flanking is great but hard to pull off.  That's fair given their other strengths as a class.
As a minor add on, Assassins don't need this because they have tools they should be using to avoid CC in the first place.
